text: A top-level domain, or TLD, are the letters that follow the final dot of the domain names. There are several kinds of TLDs: * Infrastructure: One TLD, the .arpaIANA -- .ARPA Zone Management - Retrieved December 10, 2010 * Countries: Usually they are codes with two letters according to ISO 3166. * Sponsored: They are promoted by collectives, organizations, the US government or territories with its own language and culture. * Generic: They are .com, .net, .org and .info. * Generic restricted: .edu, .gov, .mil ==Related pages== *Country code top-level domain (includes a list) == References ==
title: Top-level domain
